text: Sir Nicholas Michael Shehadie (15 November 1925 â€“ 11 February 2018) was an Australian rugby union sportsperson and politician. He was born in Sydney. He served as Lord Mayor of Sydney from 1973 to 1975. He was a national representative rugby union captain, who made thirty career Test appearances for Australia between 1947 and 1958. Shehadie was an inductee into both the Australian Rugby Union Hall of Fame and the IRB Hall of Fame. From 1957 until his death, Shehadie was married to former Governor of New South Wales Dame Marie Bashir. Shehadie died on 11 February 2018 in Sydney at the age of 92.Former Wallaby Sir Nicholas Shehadie dead, aged 92 ==Orders== *1 January 1971 Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE) for service to Local Government. *1 January 1976 Knight Bachelor for his service as Lord Mayor of Sydney. *11 June 1990 Companion of the Order of Australia (AC) for "service to the media, to sport and to community". * 17 May 2001 Knight of the Order of St John ==References== ==Other websites== *Mosman Sporting Wall of Fame *Australian Lebanese Historical Society Inc. *Nicholas Shehadie Test statistics at ESPN Scrum *Wallaby Hall of Fame *Official Website of the Governor of New South Wales Category:1925 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Australian mayors Category:Australian rugby union players Category:Rugby union players from Sydney
title: Nicholas Shehadie
